scrapingNotes: Fresh scraping from Meta Ad Library - 2026-02-24. Searched by advertiser page, not keyword.

swipes.hookFramework: Engagement Bait â†’ Profile Redirect: Uses a simple keyword comment CTA ('Comment YOUTUBE') to drive engagement, then links to Instagram profile as the conversion point. Carousel of Instagram profile links creates multiple click opportunities.
swipes.copyStructure: Single-line CTA â†’ Profile link carousel
swipes.targetAudience: Online fitness coaches who follow Will Nelson's content and want to see his YouTube strategy breakdowns
swipes.whyItWorks: Extremely low-friction entry point â€” asking for a one-word comment feels effortless and triggers algorithmic boost from engagement. The carousel of Instagram links gives multiple chances to click through. Running since Dec 2025 suggests strong performance as an evergreen top-of-funnel engagement driver.
swipeElements: carousel format for multiple click targets

swipes.headline: Online Fitness Coaches Who Want To Scale With Predictabllitiy
swipes.hookFramework: Niche Callout â†’ Benefit Promise: Calls out exact target audience in the headline ('Online Fitness Coaches') then promises the core desire ('Scale With Predictability'). Image-based ad with multiple versions being tested.
swipes.copyStructure: Headline callout â†’ Benefit promise â†’ Learn More CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Online fitness coaches doing $5-20K/mo who want predictable client acquisition
swipes.whyItWorks: The headline does all the heavy lifting â€” it's a precise niche callout that self-selects the right audience while simultaneously promising the #1 desire (predictable scaling). Multiple versions suggest active split-testing. The typo in 'Predictabllitiy' is either intentional pattern interrupt or untested â€” worth noting.
swipes.notes: Has multiple versions â€” active split testing

swipes.primaryText: If you've given up on Facebook ads for your fitness businessâ€¦ I get it. You probably blew a few thousand bucks. Got a flood of leads who couldn't afford a $20 Costco membership... let alone your high-ticket program. And you swore ads off forever. I get itâ€¦ But here's the thingâ€¦ If you haven't tried ads in the last YEAR... You're basing your opinion on an algorithm that doesn't even exist anymore. Facebook rolled out two MASSIVE updates just a few months ago called Andromeda and Lattice. I'm not gonna bore you with the techy details... But the short version is this: It's never been easier to attract clients who can actually afford to work with you. Not tire-kickers. Not "let me think about it" people. But actual real buyers. And that's where my company comes in. Because I've helped over 700 fitness coaches build predictable client acquisition systems using Facebook ads. And the last few months I have just never seen results like this before. We're seeing results that would've been straight-up impossible two years ago. Like Nick... Who tried ads for MONTHS with zero success, but used our system to book 15 calls that turned into $20k in sales. Or Amir... Who burned through $5K in failed ads before working with us, but within 4 days of working with us he made $7k in sales using our updated approach. Or Ryan and Danielle... Who wasted THOUSANDS on agencies that got them nothing but broke leads. But with MY ad system, they only had to spend $300 in ads to generate $7k in sales. Each of these people had FAILED with Facebook ads before. But now? They've got a predictable, reliable lead gen system that actually works. The reason they got results like this is because we built our Instagram Authority Funnel specifically around these new algorithm updates. So here's what I'm offering... Give me just 10 days to install our Instagram Authority Funnel at zero risk to you. Now... let me be clear. This is ONLY for online fitness coaches who: 1. Have great client results AND 2. Have a budget to spend on ads. If that's you... Then do this: Click the link below. Fill out a 60-second application. Book a call with me where I'll demo the Instagram Authority Funnel so you can see how it works from A to Z. And you can decide for yourself if it makes sense. Sound fair? Cool. Talk soon. -Will
swipes.hookFramework: Empathy Open â†’ Reframe â†’ Social Proof Stack â†’ Risk Reversal â†’ Application CTA: Opens by validating the reader's past failure ('I get it, you probably blew a few thousand bucks'), then reframes the problem as outdated information ('algorithm doesn't exist anymore'), introduces proprietary system with 3 specific case studies (Nick: $20K, Amir: $7K in 4 days, Ryan & Danielle: $300â†’$7K), offers risk reversal ('zero risk'), and closes with qualification gate.
swipes.copyStructure: Pain validation â†’ Reframe (outdated algorithm) â†’ Authority claim (700+ coaches) â†’ 3 case studies with specific numbers â†’ Proprietary system name (Instagram Authority Funnel) â†’ Risk reversal (10 days, zero risk) â†’ Qualification filter (2 criteria) â†’ Application CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Online fitness coaches who have tried and failed with Facebook ads, making $5-20K/mo with proven client results, ready to invest in paid acquisition
swipes.whyItWorks: This is Will's primary long-form ad running across 5+ variations. The genius is the empathy-to-reframe structure â€” he doesn't argue that ads work, he validates the failure and then explains WHY it failed (old algorithm). The 3 case studies follow a 'failed before â†’ succeeded with us' pattern that directly addresses the reader's exact objection. The qualification criteria at the end create exclusivity and filter for serious buyers. The conversational tone ('Cool. Talk soon. -Will') builds personal connection at scale.
swipeElements: empathy hook that validates past failure
3 named case studies with specific dollar amounts
before/after pattern for each case study
swipes.notes: This is Will's MAIN ad â€” running across 5+ creative variations with same copy. His highest-volume piece.

swipes.primaryText: You don't need more followers. You need more leads. If you've been posting content hoping it'll magically bring in clientsâ€¦ But all it's bringing is burnout â€” It's time to try something that actually scales. What you need is a system that puts your offer in front of ready-to-buy clients â€” every single day. We help online fitness coaches install simple ad systems that turn cold traffic into booked calls without being "famous" on Instagram. â†’ No big audience â†’ No viral content â†’ No begging for DMs Just leads. Every day. ðŸ‘‰ Click Learn More to see how it works.
swipes.hookFramework: Contrarian Statement â†’ Pain Point â†’ System Promise â†’ Anti-list: Opens with a contrarian reframe ('You don't need more followers. You need more leads.') that challenges the common content-creation hustle. Paints the pain of content burnout, then positions a systematic alternative. The anti-list (No big audience, No viral content, No begging for DMs) removes objections by negating everything the reader hates doing.
swipes.copyStructure: Contrarian hook â†’ Pain agitation (content burnout) â†’ System positioning â†’ Anti-list (what you DON'T need) â†’ Simple CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Online fitness coaches stuck in the content treadmill, posting daily but not converting, burnt out on organic social media marketing
swipes.whyItWorks: This shorter-form ad is the perfect complement to wn-003. While the long-form ad speaks to ad-skeptics, this one targets content-exhausted coaches. The contrarian opener ('You don't need more followers') challenges the dominant Instagram growth narrative. The anti-list is brilliant because it lists everything the reader is already tired of doing â€” making the alternative feel like relief rather than another tactic. Running across 13+ variations with video suggests this is a high-performer.
swipes.notes: Running across 13+ creative variations â€” clearly a top performer. Shorter than wn-003 but complementary targeting.

swipes.headline: 700+ Fitness Coaches Can't Be Wrong
swipes.primaryText: If you've given up on Facebook ads for your fitness businessâ€¦ I get it...
swipes.hookFramework: Social Proof Headline â†’ Long-form Pain-to-Solution: Headline uses volume social proof ('700+ Fitness Coaches Can't Be Wrong') as an authority anchor, paired with the same long-form copy as wn-003 but with a video creative. The headline does the trust-building before the reader even starts the copy.
swipes.copyStructure: Social proof headline â†’ Same long-form body as wn-003 â†’ Video creative â†’ Apply now CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Same as wn-003 â€” ad-skeptic fitness coaches ready for paid acquisition
swipes.whyItWorks: Same copy as wn-003 but with an authority-anchoring headline that the other versions don't have. The '700+' number is specific enough to be credible but round enough to feel impressive. Testing headline + video combination against text-only versions. 0:39 video length is ideal for attention spans.
swipes.notes: Same body copy as wn-003 but with social proof headline and video. Testing creative format.

swipes.headline: Million Dollar Client Getting System For Coaches
swipes.primaryText: You don't need more followers. You need more leads...
swipes.hookFramework: Aspirational Headline â†’ Contrarian Body: Pairs an aspirational revenue headline ('Million Dollar Client Getting System') with the shorter contrarian body copy from wn-004. The headline sells the dream outcome while the body validates the reader's frustration.
swipes.copyStructure: Aspirational headline â†’ Contrarian body copy â†’ Image creative â†’ Learn more CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Ambitious online fitness coaches who want a million-dollar system, frustrated with content marketing
swipes.whyItWorks: This variant combines the aspirational headline with the shorter, punchier body copy. The headline promises big ('Million Dollar') while the body stays grounded and relatable. Image format with description line 'The Fit Pro CEO helping clients grow their business' adds brand reinforcement. Testing image vs video with same copy.
swipes.notes: Image format variant with aspirational headline + short body copy

swipes.headline: Online Fitness Coach Who Want To Scale...
swipes.hookFramework: Niche Callout Headline â†’ Image Creative â†’ Direct CTA: Stripped-down version with just a niche-targeting headline and image. Minimal copy lets the creative do the talking. Testing whether the image/video alone can convert without long-form text.
swipes.copyStructure: Headline only â†’ Image/video â†’ Learn More CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Online fitness coaches looking to scale
swipes.whyItWorks: This minimal-copy approach tests whether Will's brand recognition and creative alone can drive clicks without the long-form persuasion. Multiple versions suggest he's testing different creatives against this same minimal headline framework.
swipes.notes: Minimal copy variant â€” testing creative-led conversion
